verbs.description: overlearn (third-person singular simple present overlearns, present participle overlearning, simple past and past participle overlearned or overlearnt)

entries.meaning: To learn (something) more than is necessary; to study excessively, to take (something) too much to heart.
examples: Why the rigmarole of a military survey before enacting a measure most Americans already favoured? Maybe he over-learned the lesson of the clobbering Bill Clinton got when he barged into this area right at the start of his presidency.

entries.meaning: (psychology, education) To learn (something) to the point where responses become instinctive.
(modeling) Mostly when talking about neural networks, to learn a task to the point where responses actually start to degrade. Compare with overfit, in model tuning contexts.
